record.attribute: HostDB is an integrated genomic and functional genomic database for the .......... sequences provided by community researchers . The database includes supplemental bioinformatics analyses and a web interface for data-mining.

Some data in HostDB is provided by independent researchers. For a list of the data integrated into HostDB and the related publications see Data Sources. Please cite the authors/providers when you use their data.

Each project in EuPathDB benefits from the advice and mentoring of people from each specific community.

HostDB

HostDB is a member of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania Philadelphia, USA the University of Georgia, Georgia, USA, and several members of the team are located at the University of Liverpool, United Kingdom, University of Glasgow, United Kingdom and The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, United Kingdom.

The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from any EuPathDB project, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data.
Please see Citing HostDB below.

We do not use or share any of your personal information for any purpose unrelated to the functionality of the websites; however, we do collect some information to help us understand how our sites are being used and to improve community support. See the Website Privacy Policy for details.

Some data in HostDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into HostDB and the related publications please see Data Sources.

When citing EuPathDB itself, please use:
